title.narrative: DDR, SCR1612 AND MINE VICTIMS

description.narrative: The National System of Comprehensive Attention and Reparation of Victims and the National Family Welfare System have increased their capacities to adopt and implement specific mechanisms and programmes on DDR as well as mine action standards, targeting girls, boys, and adolescents affected by the armed conflict., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Staff costs

participating-org.narrative: WORLD VISION INTERNATIONAL VISION MUNDIAL INTERNACIONAL

MRM - Child protection monitoring and reporting of grave violations in armed conflict (Security Council Resolutions 1612, 1882, 1888 and 1960)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The National System of Comprehensive Attention and Reparation of Victims and the National Family Welfare System have increasedtheir capacities to adopt and implement specific mechanisms and programmes on DDR as well as mine action standards, targeting girls, boys, and adolescents affected by the armed conflict.

description.narrative: UNICEF Colombia consolidated its work to guarantee the sustainability of actions with entities of the National System of Comprehensive Attention and Reparation of Victims to support the reintegration of FARC-EP disengaged children and to provide assistance to mine victims. UNICEF has continued working with institutions and local governments to consolidate the focus on children and their protection, within the framework of the implementation of the peace agreements, with an emphasis on children at risk and victims of the conflict. The work on child recruitment prevention, mine risk education; and certification,;;reintegration and transitional justice issues stands out. | Status:Met | As-of Date:16/01/2021
